666b8a4d-3e14-4a6c-b84b-7042e820d1f3.description: Learners who earn the Agilistix Academy Lean Agile Foundation (AA-LAF) credential have demonstrated a robust understanding of Lean Thinking and Lean Agile principles. Together, these skills provide a toolkit that identifies and minimises wasteful activities and processes, whilst maximising the flow of value Delivery with Agility. Credential holders understand the importance of a people-first corporate culture with Psychological Safety for everyone.
666b8a4d-3e14-4a6c-b84b-7042e820d1f3.name: Agilistix Academy - Lean Agile Foundation (AA-LAF)

alignments.name: The Scrum Guide
alignments.description: The Scrum Guide is the definition of the Scrum Framework. It should be implemented as a whole, without omissions or changes to its core design.

alignments.name: The Agile Manifesto
alignments.description: The Agile Manifesto contains the Values and Principles for Agile Software Development.

badge_template_activities.title: Passed the Agilistix Academy Lean Agile Foundation (AA-LAF) Exam.
Describe the 5 basic principles of Lean Thinking.
Distinguish between Agile and Lean.
Explain why Lean Thinking and Agile mindset are a great blend.

Describe the advantages of a Lean Agile approach vs. a traditional / waterfall approach to delivery.
List the Values of the Agile Manifesto.
Explain why Value and people come first.
Name at least 4 Principles of the Agile Manifesto.
Discuss a defined process vs. Agile empirical processes.
Discuss approaches to the empirical model for improvement and change.
Describe the business culture and the economic case required for Agile.
Describe the implication of Agile practices on individuals, teams and businesses.
Give examples of how we can respond to change in with Agile.
Describe the common Agile accountabilities roles, techniques and practices

c99acf36-3ef4-4a0f-8db5-ef154a042cf8.description: Learners who earn the Agilistix Academy Kanban Foundation (AA-KF) credential have demonstrated a practical understanding of the basics of Kanban. Credential holders must also hold the Agilistix Academy Lean Agile Foundation (AA-LAF) credential. They have demonstrated how to visualise work, apply WIP limits to minimise context switching and use Lean Thinking to eliminate waste, in order to create Flow of value Delivery with Agility.
c99acf36-3ef4-4a0f-8db5-ef154a042cf8.name: Agilistix Academy - Kanban Foundation (AA-KF)

alignments.name: The Agile Manifesto

06a0791b-93a4-407a-ac85-1075579e2d4c.description: Learners who earn the Agilistix Academy Scrum Foundation (AA-SF) credential have demonstrated a solid understanding of the basics of Scrum, how it works, why it works and how to use it. Credential holders must also hold the Agilistix Academy Lean Agile Foundation (AA-LAF) credential. They are well-placed to join existing Scrum teams and understand how Lean Thinking principles and practices can be applied to Scrum to reduce waste and maximise the Flow of value Delivery with Agility.
06a0791b-93a4-407a-ac85-1075579e2d4c.name: Agilistix Academy - Scrum Foundation (AA-SF)

1dd77597-94e9-4051-945f-fcd445c32229.description: Learners who earn the Agilistix Academy Scrum Master (AA-SM) credential have demonstrated a solid understanding of being accountable for a Scrum Team’s effectiveness. Credential holders must also hold the Agilistix Academy Scrum Foundation (AA-SF) credential. They have demonstrated how to apply Lean Thinking principles to Scrum to reduce waste, minimise unfinished work, focus on the Scrum Commitments, whilst maximising transparency and the Flow of value Delivery with Agility.
1dd77597-94e9-4051-945f-fcd445c32229.name: Agilistix Academy - Scrum Master (AA-SM)

2e7b2132-5e44-4a4a-9f18-4657e93b75a9.description: Learners who earn the Agilistix Academy Kanban for Teams (AA-KFT) credential have demonstrated a practical knowledge of implementing Kanban. Credential holders must also hold the Agilistix Academy Kanban Foundation (AA-KF) credential. They have demonstrated how to utilise Lean Thinking techniques to help teams to continuously improve the Flow of value Delivery with Agility, identify process bottlenecks, define Policies, shorten feedback loops and leverage the power of metrics for Kaizen.

26ff709c-2eff-453f-b899-1aa2f6d28c9a.description: Managing content created by multiple users within a organisation is becoming increasingly important. One of the most popular Content Management Systems (CMS) in use today is Microsoft SharePoint. This course introduces the Learner to some of the basic principles of Content Management with Microsoft SharePoint 2013.
26ff709c-2eff-453f-b899-1aa2f6d28c9a.name: Agilistix Academy - Content Management with SharePoint (AA-CMS1)

badge_template_activities.title: There are no prerequisites for this course.
SharePoint Overview
Introduction to SharePoint Hierarchy
Introduction to Library Types
SharePoint Interface and Basic Navigation
Understanding Security Trimming
SharePoint Gear Icon & Site Contents
Viewing Files and Folders
Introduction to Custom Views
Using Basic Search Features

87803732-368e-4e2b-a349-95011bffa2a6.description: Managing content created by multiple users within a organisation is becoming increasingly important. d723ca80-d09b-495e-b930-395265c69957.description: Create an outline Business Agility strategy that You can use immediately! This credential is earned by Learners who have demonstrated a foundational understanding of Delivery With Agility Leadership concepts. Learners have discovered how Delivery with Agility Leadership delivers an unfair commercial advantage in a rapidly-changing VUCA (Volatility, Uncertainty, Complexity, Ambiguity) world. Ideal for business Executives, Leaders, Managers, Project Managers, Agile Coaches, Scrum Masters
d723ca80-d09b-495e-b930-395265c69957.name: Agilistix Academy Delivery With Agility Leadership (AA-DWAL1)

badge_template_activities.title: There are no prerequisites for this credential.
The Learning Outcomes described below indicate that by the end of this course, you will be able to:
Describe the need for business agility in a VUCA world.
Explain the business case for the adoption of Lean Agile.
Explain why culture change is necessary for business agility.
Describe the difference in behaviour of a Lean Agile leader vs. a traditional leader.
Explain how a People-first culture nurtures Value-first outcomes.
Explain the importance of psychological safety within your organisation.
Explain the “How Can I Help” management style.
Explain the importance of a Delivery-focussed culture.
Describe the 5 basic principles of Lean Thinking.
Distinguish between Agile and Lean.
Explain why Lean Thinking and Agile mindset are a great blend.
Discuss how to empower self-managing teams.
Describe the blockers for Delivery With Agility.
Name the 8 Wastes of Lean.
Describe the advantages of a Lean Agile approach vs. a traditional / waterfall approach to value delivery.
Describe the implication of Agile practices on individuals, teams and businesses.

832440a3-b9f0-48a7-8e57-9aab2cd39883.description: This credential is earned by Learners who have demonstrated a competent and practical understanding of Delivery With Agility concepts, when applied to more than one of our Lean Agile Learning paths, such as but not limited to, Scrum and Kanban. Ideal for Scrum Masters and Agile Coaches who want to empower their teams and engage organisational leadership in robust and sustainable Lean Agile product delivery.
832440a3-b9f0-48a7-8e57-9aab2cd39883.name: Agilistix Academy - Delivery With Agility Practitioner (AA-DWAP)

dae6eb0d-b8f9-4ff3-98de-3815c6dd4d5d.description: Maximising transparency during Lean Agile product development and delivery is paramount. This course will enable your teams to get started using Microsoft Azure DevOps to visualise the flow of their work.
dae6eb0d-b8f9-4ff3-98de-3815c6dd4d5d.name: Agilistix Academy - Lean Agile Product Delivery With Azure DevOps

badge_template_activities.title: There are no prerequisites for this course
By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Describe basic Work Item Types
Create a Product Backlog
Update a Product Backlog
Create Product Backlog Items
Update Product Backlog Items
Delete Product Backlog Items
Prioritise Product Backlog Items
Create a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)
Use ADO Boards to track your progress

81caa739-b995-4438-bd05-966d63725f48.description: With the complexities of modern product development, rising costs, and the challenging economic climate, it is vital to maximise the flow of value delivery to your customers. Learn how to visualise your end-to-end Value Stream to identify waste, reduce waiting time, see the bottlenecks and eliminate them. Experience Lean Thinking in action.
81caa739-b995-4438-bd05-966d63725f48.name: Agilistix Academy - Value Stream Management Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Explain what Value Stream Management is
Describe the process of creating a Value Stream Map
Create a Value Stream Map using only a pencil and paper
Visualise a process in your workplace
Identify where the bottle necks are in a process
Identify waste in a process that is hindering the flow of value delivery

337c4f08-8657-422a-8358-ca1fa0645b0d.description: Delivery-first mindset, then People-first Lean Agile behaviours - we call it Delivery With Agility! Effective product delivery hinges around robust Product Ownership. Product Ownership is at the core of value delivery, yet it is normally the weakest link in Scrum Teams. The essentials of Product Ownership is the highlight of this course as it requires no prior knowledge of Scrum but gets down to hands-on discovery with a real Product Backlog.
337c4f08-8657-422a-8358-ca1fa0645b0d.name: Delivery With Agility - Product Ownership (DWA-PO)

badge_template_activities.title: There are no prerequisites for this credential.
The Learning Outcomes described below indicate that by the end of this course, you will be able to:
Explain why execution of Delivery is vital
Explain why a People-First culture is essential
Create a Value Proposition for your product
Define a Product Goal
Justify a Product Goal to stakeholders and teams
Ensure your Product Backlog is understood
Maximise the value of the product
Refine a Product Backlog
Effectively Manage Your Product Backlog
Refine a Product Backlog
Collaborate with your team to define a Sprint Goal

b641e769-54d4-4ea6-acf2-1a0c08e92bca.description: Delivery-first mindset, then People-first Lean Agile behaviours - we call it Delivery With Agility! Concentrating on the essentials to reboot your teams to focus on Lean Agile delivery and giving them the tools and Kaizen Coaching to do so.
b641e769-54d4-4ea6-acf2-1a0c08e92bca.name: Delivery With Agility - Team Professional (DWA-TP)

badge_template_activities.title: There are no prerequisites for this credential.
The Learning Outcomes described below indicate that by the end of this course, you will be able to:
Explain why execution of Delivery is vital
Explain why a People-First culture is essential
Maximise your team's flow of value delivery
Eliminate waste from your product delivery process
